page.title: 06Church in Ingleton
page.content: The present church, which is the third church on the same site, was built in 1886 so it will be a hundred years old next year.The tower was built in the twelve hundreds.The bells were put in the tower in 1840.The bells in the tower are made of cast steel.We think that a London Foundry made them and put them there.The oldest stained glass window is in the west end of the tower, the next oldest after that dates from 1879.The font is Norman it is about 900 hundred years old.The first organ was installed in 1935 and another one, after that, which is electric was installed in 1978.The pulpit was built with the present church in 1888.The furniture with the carved mice has been there since the first World War.The flags have been there since just after the First World War.
